It's almost guaranteed that you completed this quest. I cannot imagine how it is even possible to not have completed The Mine Grind at this point. But just in case....

You should have already been requested to make all of the Tinkers' Casts, or maybe not. They don't even unlock anything (other than completing this quest) but you now need to make all of them to unlock the rest of the quests in the BQ questbook.
It's like a transformer, but it's high............... wait.
I mean... it's in Pipes & Power Plus... but is it really... it's unlocked by completing like the last questline. You may have even forgotten about this quest until now. It still may be uncompleted!
Clip clip!
Produces nickel or something. I don't know.
I can say with great assurance that you have never used this machine in your life. Let me take it off your hands.
From the title, I, and therefore you, can infer these seeds produce quartz.
Yes, the sieve upgrade. I'm sure you haven't thought about that in like a year.
What a weird name for a seed.
Chocolate, caramel, and fudge! What more could you want? I for sure want this. Give it to me.
The last glass quest in Extra Random.

The Thaumonomicon is THE book for Thaumcraft. It contains all of the information about the mod, and will help you along the way as you progress in Thaumcraft. It should be noted that many recipes the Thaumonomicon show are not the actual recipes for this modpack, and therefore will not work. Please use NEI when looking up any recipe.
The Hoe of Growth...... It can till in a 3x3 area. It also acts as bonemeal on right click and can grow everything bonemeal can, and more!

Can cast spells, as well as many other useful things in Thaumcraft. The GUI at the top left-hand corner shows how much "magical power" is in your wand. Get "magical power" by extracting vis from nodes found in the world. To extract vis, hold right click while pointing at a node.

The Research Table is where you combine or connect "aspects" found in your world. This is a crucial step in Thaumcraft. To create a Research Table, craft and place two Tables next to each other. Then, right click the table with a scribing tool. Once you have created your research table, open it and you will find a bunch of icons. These icons are called aspects. There are many more things you can do with the research table, but for now, we will only do one of the most simple tasks: Combining Aspects. The aspects you currently have are basic. Combine them to create new, more complex aspects. To combine aspects, click on any two aspects you currently have. These aspects will go into the two slots at the bottom left side of the GUI. To combine, click the purple arrow. Keep in mind you have a limited amount of each aspect, and the aspects you chose are consumed, even if you did not successfully combine. Feel free to experiment. A good goal for you right now is to combine aspects to get "Victus."

Now it is time to begin the complicated process of research. Almost every item in Thaumcraft is unlocked through research. To start, you will need some paper in your inventory, as well as scribing tools.

The next step is to go into your Thaumonomicon and right click an unlocked piece of research. This will give you a research note. Almost every icon in your Thaumonimicon is research. Any will do, but for right now, we will research Nitor. Nitor is found in the alchemy tab in your Thaumonomicon. Right click the Nitor icon in your Thaumonomicon. This will turn one piece of paper into research papers for Nitor.

There are many more things you can do with the research table, but for now, we will only do one of the most simple tasks: Combining Aspects. The aspects you currently have are basic. Combine them to create new, more complex aspects. To combine aspects, click on any two aspects you currently have. These aspects will go into the two slots at the bottom left side of the GUI. To combine, click the purple arrow. Keep in mind you have a limited amount of each aspect, and the aspects you chose are consumed, even if you did not successfully combine. Feel free to experiment. A good goal for you right now is to combine aspects to get "Victus." You may checkmark this task once you have discovered "Victus." Consult the "Aspects of Magic" page in your Thaumonimicon for more information.

Once you have the research paper, place it in the slot next to where you put your Scribing Tools in the Research Table. Upon doing this, it will unlock a minigame on the right side of the screen. The goal of the minigame is to connect two or more aspects together. Aspects connect if the aspect creates the other aspect, or if the aspect is made out of the other aspect. (For example, earth and water make life, so life connects to water, and earth connects to life.) So, simply drag and drop aspects that will connect to each other into the board until everything eventually connects. If one of the aspects is a question mark at the beginning of the game, it means you do not know that aspect, and you need to keep combining and/or scanning. Once you have connected everything, the research note will turn into a discovery. Take the discovery in your hand and right click it to unlock information about it in the Thaumonimicon.

The Crucible is another form of crafting. It combines items and makes other items. Each Cauldron recipe also has a special item, or "catalyst." The catalyst is whatever item is shown above the cauldron in the recipe. (For example, in Nitor, it is glowstone, so once you have the ingredients in, you'd toss glowstone in as well to create Nitor.) The other crafting ingredients for crucible crafting are the aspects in the crucible. Throwing any block in the crucible will add its aspects into the crucible. To get the crucible, simply right click a Cauldron with your wand. It needs water in it and a heat source below it. Shift-right-click with your wand to empty the Cauldron. Side effects may include, but are not limited to, Taint.

Research the Deconstruction Table by doing the 3 steps of Research you already did with Nitor. It is in the first tab of your Thaumonomicon, you may need to research a few more things first though. After you've researched it, you will have the ability to craft it. Place items in the top slot of the table, and you might get one of their aspects in return. You can put up to a stack of items in the table at a time. Keep in mind that the more amount of the item you have in the table, the less chance you have of getting aspects. This is a great way to gain aspects. Use your Thaumonomicon for more info.
Nitor is a magical light. You should have already done the research for Nitor. Now you just need to craft it in the crucible. You can see the recipe either in your Thaumonomicon, or use NEI.

Shards are used in many important crafting recipes. There are two ways to obtain shards. One is by finding "Infused Stone." Upon breaking Infused Stone, a shard will drop respective to the type of infused stone you mined. (Air Infused Stone drops Air Shards.) The other way to get shards is by breaking specific items with an Ex Nihilo hammer. NEI will help you there.

The Arcane Worktable is a type of crafting table added by Thaumcraft. A select few thaumcraft recipes have to be crafted in the Archane Worktable, but most can be crafted in any other crafting table. To create the Archane Worktable, right click your wand onto a single table. Use an axe to pick it up. To use the worktable, place your wand in the top right corner slot. The vis collected in the wand will appear in the slots around the workbench. Some recipes require vis.

The Thaumometer is a fundemental tool in Thaumcraft. With it, you can study blocks, items, and all entities in your world. To study something, point your Thaumometer at it and hold the right mouse button. Once you study something, you will discover and/or collect the aspects that make up the block or item you studied. Almost everything can be studied, but only once however. For many things, if you attempt to study it, it will say you need to learn another aspect in order to study the block, item, or entity. This is because whatever you attempted to study contains "compound" or "complex" aspects. Compound and complex aspects are aspects made out of two other aspects. You must research these aspects if you wish to learn about the block, item, or entity you are scanning. Consult the "Aspects of Magic" page of your Thaumonomicon for more information.

Vis is magical energy that is used in some recipes. Vis is stored in your wand and you know how much vis you have by holding your wand and looking at the GUI in the top left corner of your screen. Shift to see numbers. Alternatively, you can hold shift while looking at your wand in your inventory to see what you have. There are two ways to aquire vis. One is by killing vanilla and thaumcraft mobs (Both hostile and passive). Upon killing, the mobs will drop "Aspect Orbs," which are Vis. Put your wand in your hotbar to pick up the orbs. Different mobs drop different amounts of each aspect. Experiment to see which mobs drop which aspects the most. You may need to find a taint biome to kill tainted mobs.

Aura Nodes will spawn randomly in your world. They are little floating blocks that almost look like particles. They contain Vis as well as an abundant amount of aspects. You can study them to get a lot of aspects. You can also extract vis out of them by holding your wand and holding right mouse button. Check the box when you have found and extracted vis from at least one Aura Node.

With the Goggles of Revealing equipped, you can see how many aspects are in your Cauldron and Arcane Alembics, making it easier to craft. You'll also be able to see which aspects are in a node just by looking at it. Notice that aspects slowly disappear into the atmosphere, so you'll want to use your Cauldron quickly.

Research Wand Foci. Wand Foci is found in the Thaumaturgy section of your book. Wand Foci will unlock many different "focuses" for your wand, which will allow you to do some useful things. Check the box when you have completed the research.

Some research may be required. The Equal Trade Focus turns blocks into other blocks. To choose which block you would like to make other blocks, simply shift right click the block with your wand in hand. Then, right click any other block. Note that you must have the block in your inventory in order to place it. For more information, consult your Thaumonimicon. While in use, it uses 0.05 Ordo, 0.05 Terra, and 0.05 Perditio per tick.

Attatch a lens to a mana spreader by right clicking. Lenses give the mana spreader special abilities. The basic Mana Lens does nothing at all, but is the base for the rest of the lenses. The Velocity Lens increases the movement of the mana bursts, but at a cost. The Potency Lens doubles the amount of mana in a mana burst, at a cost, however. The Resistance Lens increases the amount of time a mana burst can go without fading out. Again, at a cost. The Efficiency Lens is like the Resistance Lens. The Bounce Lens allows mana to "bounce" off of walls. Usually, a mana burst would be destroyed if it ever touches a block that won't accept mana. The Gravity Lens makes mana bursts move in an arch towards the ground. The Bore Lens charges mana bursts up so they can break through blocks in their way. The Damaging Lens charges mana bursts up so they can damage mobs (players included). The Phantom Lens allows mana bursts to pass through blocks. The Magnetizing Lens makes the mana burst home into blocks that use mana. The Entropic Lens causes mana to make an explosion when it collides with something that won't accept mana. The Influence Lens causes dropped items, experience orbs, and falling blocks to move in the direction of the mana burst. The Weight Lens gives a gravity effect to any block the mana burst hits, causing blocks to fall to the floor (if there isn't a block under them). The Kindle Lens allows the mana burst to set any block it hits on fire. It cannot set mobs or players on fire, though. The Force Lens makes the mana burst act as a piston to blocks it hits. The Flash Lens causes the mana burst to spawn a mystic flame when it hits a block. This flame is not dangerous. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Shoots a laser beam that mines all blocks. (With the exception of Bedrock and End Portal Frames) Uses 0.1 Terra per tick.

Currently, you only have the most basic wand in all of Thaumcraft. It has very little Vis storage and is not efficient at extracting vis. You can now upgrade to a Greatwood Wand Core and Copper Caps. All of the ingredients need to be researched first. In addition, you cannot simply upgrade parts of your wand like you can to tools in Tinkers. You need to create an entirely new wand. Find the greatwood core and copper caps in the Thaumaturgy section of your Thaumonomicon. Your new wand now has space for 50 Vis of each type instead of 25. There is also a decrease in Vis cost.
Some research may be required. The Shock Focus shoots lightning bolts from your wands at right click. While in use, it uses 0.25 Aer per tick.
Fires frozen projectiles. Uses 0.05 Aqua, 0.02 Ignis, and 0.02 Perditio per cast.

Now that you have researched Wand Foci, you have access to the Fire Focus. To equip a focus hold F (default key) while your wand is in your hand. Notice that a focus must be in your inventory for it to appear in the selection GUI. Select the focus you want by clicking it. The Fire Focus shoots flames at a right click. While in use, it consumes 0.1 Ignis Vis per tick.

Copper Capped Wands were just the start. What you really want is a gold capped wand. With gold caps you have, on average, a 100% vis exchange rate from aura nodes. So if you have the capacity for it, you can gain all the vis a node has to offer. Again, you have to craft a new wand from scratch. Some research will be required in the Thaumaturgy section of your Thaumonomicon.

Inert silver caps will not work on a wand. You need to charge them using arcane infusion. Place the ingredients on the pedestal like you see in NEI. The item in the middle goes in the middle pedestal and any other items go on surrounding pedestals. Silver caps give a slightly better vis exchange rate for the 4 main elements (Air, Fire, Water, and Earth). Same 2 rules apply: You have to research it and you have to create a new wand. However, you should have unlocked more options for wand cores, so I'll let you choose how you want to make your wand!
Like silver caps, you have to use charged thaumium caps for them to do any good. Once you charge them, though, they are very efficient in extracting all kinds of vis.
Welcome back to The Mine Grind, everybody! Round 2! This time, we're hunting for Dark Gems, which come from Dark Ore.

Now that you've researched The Goggles of Revealing, you have access to the Arcane Ear. It will emit a redstone pulse whenever a noteblock plays within hearing distance of it. It needs to be able to recognize the sound though, so you'll want to place it above the same block type the noteblock is on. (i.e. if the noteblock is on a grass block, place the Arcane Ear on a grass block)

The act of Infusion is the next way to get items in Thaumcraft, therefore advancing through the mod. To get started, you need to construct an Infusion Altar (multiblock diagram can be found in Artifice tab under the Infusion page.) Surround the altar with between two to twelve pedestals. Once you've placed all of the blocks correctly, right click the arcane matrix with your wand to complete the multiblock. Make sure there is at least 25 of each vis in it. WARNING: SOME INFUSION RECIPES MAY COME WITH SERVERE SIDEAFFECTS ON THE WORLD AROUND YOU! USE WITH CAUTION!

Distillation is a way of breaking down pretty much every block in the game into essentia. You'll need an Alchemical Furnace and Arcane Alembic, the research for which can be found in the Alchemy section past Nitor and Alumentum. Once you have them crafted, place the Arcane Alembic ontop of the Alchemical Furnace. Note that you can have a maximum of 5 Arcane Alembics ontop of an Alchemical Furnace. Fuels for the furnace include Alumentum, and classic vanilla fuels. Place virtually any item into the top slot of the furnace. It will break down into aspects. Aspects will go into the arcane alembic. If you have your goggles of revealing on, you can see what aspects went into the arcane alembic(s.)
Silverwood & Greatwood are important crafting ingredients in Thaumcraft. They are naturally spawning tress. You may have to adventure a fair distance to find them though.
A magical projectile explosion made in the crucible. The research can be found in the Alchemy section of the Thaumonomicon right below Nitor. It is also the best fuel for the Alchemical Furnace.

The arcane alembics can only hold 32 of 1 aspect at a time, so you'll probably want to empty them out soon. You can empty them using glass phials by right clicking. Please note the phial can only hold 8 essentia at a time. No more. No less. To upgrade your storage to something that can hold a bit more, you can place your newly collected essentia-in-a-phial into a glass jar. (Research for a glass jar is right above research for phials)

You can semi-automate the storage of essentia using Essentia Tubes! The research for Essentia Tubes is right below the Arcane Furnace in the Thaumonomicon. The pipes can be a bit of a task to manage though. You can't have two types of Essentia in the pipe at the same time. As a solution, you can make a valve. The valves stop the flow of essentia through a pipe system so you can control what is piped when and where.

The Infernal Furnace acts like a normal furnace..... for the most part...... but has crucial advantages! It never needs any fuel, it can sometimes double the output. Find the multiblock setup diagram in your Thaumonomicon under the Artifice tab. To complete the multiblock structure, right click it with your wand. Make sure it has at least 50 Ignis and 50 Terra in it. The input is at the top where the hole is, and the output pops out of the iron bar. Side effects: Warp

You can upgrade the Infernal Furnace by piping in Ignis from a jar into one of the holes on the side. You can also add up to 2 arcane bellows to the other two holes to increase yieldd, increase speed, and decrease warp effect.
Please give me your XP storage. Thank you!
A filing cabinet made out of magical wood.
Now I bet you use this machine on the daily, no joke. So it might be worth it just to make the parts again so you don't lose your multiblock.
This might take you a while to get, especially for me just to take it away again..... oh well! Sucks to be you!
It's a bird! It's a plane! No, it's super torch!
These very well could be powering your base right now! Then again, EnderIO conduits are a thing.
LOL. How random.

betterquesting:10.desc:8: You have either used this pipe to death ever since you made it & it has been very very useful to you, or you stuck it in a chest or trashcan somewhere and never thought about it again.... UNTIL TODAY!
Ender IO's attempt at solar panels. These are the upgraded kind.

Despite the fact that obsidian armor, or obsidian armour if you prefer, is part of the armor set, or armour set if you prefer, in the transportation questline, it is possible to complete every other quest in the HQM book without making obsidian armor, or obsidian armour if you prefer. Hence this quest.
GIVE ME IT!
Generates power.... I think. Remember you can always look in the old and outdated HQM book for more info on these. Jog your memory maybe?
The last (or one of the last, depending on how you look at it) armor, or armour if you prefer, quests in the Transportation questline.
Yes, I am now Thanos "asking" for the all powerful space stone. Thank you in advance.

It might seem like a random item to hand in to verify that you have completed all of the storage questline, but it is possible to have skipped the framed drawer quest in HQM while completing the rest of the questline. That is the goal of this questline btw, in case you still weren't getting it.
This is probably sitting in a chest somewhere, you should have better ways of storing things by now.
Potato patato, beacon bacon, tomato tamato.

If you have already applied your tank to your adventure backpack, you might need to make a new one. Or maybe not.... do you really think I know how any of these mods work!? I just run through NEI or JEI or whatever I put in this modpack and say "Oh, that looks like a good item for a quest!" I don't actually do any research or put any thought into this jeeze! How do you think I've managed to surpass 800 quests!?
This is probably one of the most expensive recipes that does not have an Xtreme recipe in Questing Mayhem. Now I'm taking it away from you with this quest. You are so welcome. ;)

Honestly, looking back at the quests regarding AE2, I did really poorly. I didn't even have you make a wireless terminal, which is required for the wireless booster to be in any way useful! Sorry about that. Anyway, give me the things.
I tried, okay? This is a crafting ingredient, so craft it.

Remember The Aether? Yeah? In case you didn't know, you gathered coins while you were completing quests there. Specifically, you got them when you were killing Aether mobs. In their base form, you can do nothing with them. They just show up in the Aether section of your inventory. However, with an alchemical coinmill, you can convert 100 Aether coins into 1 alchemical coin which is used in crafting recipes. It may be worth going back to The Aether if you don't have many Aether coins.
Used for some crafting recipes.
Used for some crafting recipes.
Used for some crafting recipes.
Alchemical coal is used in many crafting recipes and can smelt items in a furnace for 4x longer than coal.

The Avaritia Crafting Table! This is your first step to the true endgame of Questing Mayhem. With this crafting table, you will be able to craft insanely overpowered weapons, gear, and machines (at a price of course). We're in the endgame now.

The Neutron Collector passively collects piles of Neutrons over time. These piles of Neutrons can be turned into Neutron Nuggets which can be turned into Neutron Ingots. Neutron Ingots are used in crafting recipes. This process can take a while, though, so it is recommended you setup several Neutron Collectors.
The smoothie quests in the Pam's questline in the HQM book.
A quest for all 24 jelly sandwiches in Pam's. Also in the HQM book.
Collected in the Neutron Collector over time. They are combined to make nuggets and used in various Xtreme Crafting Recipes.

The Neutronium Compressor can make singularities out of 56 resources in the game. All of the resources require a specific amount of their block form to be inserted into the Neutronium Compressor to make one singularity of that resource.
The last yogurt you have to make in Dining With Pam
Unlocked in Dining With Pam by completing 8 other quests in the questline.
Made of 9 neutronium nuggets. They are combined together to make blocks and used in various Xtreme Crafting Recipes.
Made from 9 piles of neutrons. They are combined together to make ingots and used in various Xtreme Crafting Recipes.
The last dessert quest in HQM.
Requires many other food quests to be completed in HQM.
The last MFR machine in HQM.
1 radius decrease for MFR Machines.
The last MFR upgrade in HQM.
Made of 9 neutronium ingots. They are used in various Xtreme Crafting Recipes.
A semi-stand-a-lone quest in HQM.
A stand-a-lone quest in HQM.
A stand-a-lone quest in HQM.
A stand-a-lone quest in HQM.

A stand-a-lone quest in HQM.
(Block Update Detector & Advanced Block Update Detector) A stand-a-lone quest in HQM.

30,750 Nickel Blocks in 1 Item.
25,125 Mana Infused Blocks in 1 Item.

Coal Ore found in the nether. Also a quest in HQM
Emerald Ore found in the nether. Also a quest in HQM.

A portal to a skyblock-like dimension. Also a quest in HQM.
Empties oxygen tanks the fastest. Also a quest in HQM.
Fills oxygen tanks the fastest. Also a quest in HQM.
Faster than a regular refinery. Also holds more fuel. Also a quest in HQM.
Loads fuel the fastest and has the most capacity. Also a quest in HQM.
The last NASA Schematic you are obligated to collect. You are allowed to keep this one. They're really really hard to find.
26,175 Blue Gem Blocks in 1 Item.

Unlock the research for it in the Thaumaturgy section. In addition to holding more vis than a greatwood core, it also passively gives you Terra vis when it drops below 10 percent. The same rule for caps applies to wand cores; you have to make a new wand to put it to any use.

Unlock the research for it in the Thaumaturgy section. In addition to holding more vis than a greatwood core, it also passively gives you Ignis vis when it drops below 10 percent. The same rule for caps applies to wand cores; you have to make a new wand to put it to any use.

Unlock the research for it in the Thaumaturgy section. In addition to holding more vis than a greatwood core, it also passively gives you Aer vis when it drops below 10 percent. The same rule for caps applies to wand cores; you have to make a new wand to put it to any use.

Unlock the research for it in the Thaumaturgy section. In addition to holding more vis than a greatwood core, it also passively gives you Aqua vis when it drops below 10 percent. The same rule for caps applies to wand cores; you have to make a new wand to put it to any use.

Unlock the research for it in the Thaumaturgy section. In addition to holding more vis than a greatwood core, it also passively gives you Ordo vis when it drops below 10 percent. The same rule for caps applies to wand cores; you have to make a new wand to put it to any use.

While some basic infusion recipes are harmless, there are other, more complex recipes, that can have major side effects. You can place White Tallow Candles, vanilla monster heads, and crystals around the infusion multiblock to keep you safe......r.
There is one last shard you have not yet obtained. It is the balanced shard, a shard forged by crucible of all six other shards.
Find the research for Thaumium right below your research for the Crucible. Thaumium is a powerful metal in Thaumcraft.
Some miscellaneous items you can craft with Thaumium.
The first Thaumium Armour set. (1 out of 2)
The second Thaumium Armour set. (2 out of 2)

The Axe of the Stream. Find the research for it to the left of Infusion. It acts as a magnet on right click. When you chop trees with it, the axe will automatically chop the farthest log from you in the tree, therefore chopping all the logs in the tree. It also increases leaf decay.

Unlock the research for it in the Thaumaturgy section. In addition to holding more vis than a greatwood core, it also passively gives you Perditio vis when it drops below 10 percent. The same rule for caps applies to wand cores; you have to make a new wand to put it to any use.
Silverwood is the final and best material to make a wand core out of. It can hold up to 100 of each vis.
The Shovel of the Earthmover. Find the research for it near the Axe of the Stream. It can dig in a 3x3 area, like a tinkers' construct excavator or hammer. It can also place blocks in a 3x3 area.
In the Golemancy section of your Thaumonomicon, you will find the page for a Hungry Chest. It works similarly to a hopper in that it will automatically pick up and store items dropped near it.
Golemancy is automation through Golem slaves. Fun, right? The first golem (slave) you can "build" is a straw golem.

To get the golem to do anything, you're going to need a Golemancer's Bell, and an Animation Core. (Find both reseaches connecting to Straw Golems) The Golemancer's Bell helps you instruct the golems, and animation cores, allow golems to do certain tasks. The first animation core you can make is the Gatherer Core, which will automatically pick up items on the floor, and carry them to a selected chest.

Below the gather core in your Thaumonomicon, there is the harvest core. A golem with the harvest core will automatically harvest fully grown crops, but will not replant them. For that, you'll need an Order Upgrade.
With the golemancer's bell, you can assign "colors" to different blocks and make golems do certain things with certain "colors."

Each type of golem has different attributes which you can find in their respective page in the Thaumonomicon. Straw Golems are generally pretty bad, especially in the fact that they can only carry 1 item at a time. Wooden Golems are a bit of an upgrade. Use your Thaumonomicon for more information, including the stats of both straw and wood golems.
Air upgrades simply increase the speed of a golem.
Makes golems see further, therefore allowing them to travel further and perform their job in a bigger area.

Increases the maximum amount of items a golem can carry. If the golem is more of an attacker than a worker, you will also notice an increase in the amount of damage they'll do, and the amount of damage they can take.
Increases all parts of the golem's inventory from their normal. Melee attacks will also set the enemy on fire.
When a golem gets attacked, the attacker will take damage as well. (Like the Thorns enchantment)
Takes items from an inventory and moves them somewhere new.
Attacks any hostile mob within its range.
Fishes. For best results, place the golem with this core near deep water.
Chops down any tress within its range.

Takes specific items from one inventory and takes them to their "home" inventory. There are 2 modes: Precise Amount, where you can specify the exact amount of an item you want the golem to take. Also Any Amount mode, where the golem will take as much as it can of the item.
Will take items out of an inventory and attempt to right click or left click the item onto a specified block.
Will attack passive animals in a farm. Don't worry though, it will only kill the oldest animals and will always leave 2 alive for breeding.
Takes items from its own inventory and puts it in another chest where the item is also present.
Will attempt to keep a fluid container filled with a specified fluid.
Transports essentia from Arcane Alembics to Jars.
IDK what to say.
I feel like I've already used these exact words for a description in this very questline, but I'm tired and lazy, so screw it. Why would you even use this?

The Pickaxe of the Core. When you right click with the pickaxe in hand, it will reveal nearby ores. There is also a chance you will get a cluster of the ore you are mining (if the ore has a native cluster variant, of course).
Under Magical Metallurgy, you will find Metal Purification. Base clusters exist for iron, gold, copper, tin, silver, and lead. A metal cluster smelts to produce double the normal output.
In addition to infused stone, there are two more ores you will find in the ground that yield important materials. See right of the quest book.

Sword of the Zephyr. Creates a whirlwind on right click that blocks enemy attacks, including projectiles. The whirlwind also picks you up in its drift. It can also attack multiple enemies at once. (Similar to Minecraft 1.9+ combat)
The Bow of Bone. Acts like a vanilla bow, but it fires faster, and any arrows you launch with it will travel faster and hit harder.

There is a different arrow for each different aspect, and each aspect gives arrows different properties. Air Arrows bypass armour. Fire Arrows ignite the victim on fire. Water Arrows slow the victim down. Earth Arrows hit harder. Order Arrows weaken the enemy. Entropy Arrows wither the enemy. Note that these arrows cannot be picked back up once they have fired, and the Infinity enchantment works only sometimes.

If you place the Node Stabilizer under a node, it gives many beneficial effects and characteristics to the node. You can find exactly what it does in the Thaumonomicon under Thaumaturgy. It's worth noting you must research Master Node Tapping in order to have the node stabilizer available to research. Find master node tapping under the Basic Information tab.
If you place the Wand Recharge Pedestal near a node, and place your wand on it, the wand will automatically start recharging vis from the node.
Place the Lamp of Fertility near animals, and it will make them breed using victus.
Place the Lamp of Growth near crops and it will speed up the growth rate by using Herba.
The Paving Stone of Warding Block prevents most mobs from walking into that area, so you can keep them in place and not have to worry about them getting in an inconvenient spot.
Unlike the Stone of Warding, the Stone of Travel encourages people to walk on it by granting them faster speed when they walk on it.
25,995 Energetic Alloy Blocks in 1 Item.

You can enchant items, tools, weapons, and armour through infusion. Enchanting items through infusion also allows you to pick the enchantments you want. Place the item you want to enchant in the middle of the infusion altar. Then, place the item used to get your desired enchantment on the specific pedestal shown in the book. You can see all of the recipes in the Infusion Enchantment section in the Artifice tab. To enchant, you'll need essentia in jars and xp on your person.

The Node Transducer transforms a normal node into an energized node. Energized nodes cannot transfer vis directly. You'll need a vis relay to get the vis from the node. Place the Node Transducer above a stabilized node and apply a redstone signal to energize it. Once the vis is energized, place the relays nearby so it can be sent to other specific machines.
The Essentia Crystallizer turns liquid essentia (which you'll need to pipe in) into essentia crystals which are used in the crucible. You can use energized terra to speed the process up.

The Traveling Trunk works almost identically to OpenBlocks' Luggage. It follows you around so you can put items in it. It does not, however, pick up items off the ground. Find it in the golemancy tab.
25,800 White Gem Blocks in 1 Item

The Arcane Bore is a way of automatically mining. Place the Bore ontop of the Bore Base. Change the direction the Bore faces by right clicking it with your wand. Place an excavation focus and a pickaxe inside the GUI. Apply a redstone signal to make it start mining. The Bore Base spits the blocks it mines out. You can also feed it Perditio to speed it up.

The Focal Manipulator allows you to give upgrades to Foci, making your wand even better. There are many upgrades you can apply to your wand. To enchant foci, you'll need vis and experiance on your person. Place the focus in the middle of the focal manipulator and select an upgrade at the bottom. Click "Start Upgrade." More upgrades unlock the more times you upgrade foci.
The Portable Hole is a wand focus. It creates a temporary 3x3 hole through whatever block you place it. Be careful though, you may get stuck in the blocks when the temporary part kicks in.

Crafting Scepters are designed for arcane crafting. They hold 50% more vis than a normal wand of the same core. Upgrade today and get a 10% vis discount. But that's not all. Improve it further by adding thaumium caps and wearing thaumium gear.

Staves hold much more vis than wands, so they are great for using foci with. They are inefficient with arcane crafting, however. If the staff's wand core counterpart has a special ability, that ability is also present in the staff, in fact it will most likely be improved. Please note that staves will still need caps. Use Thaumium caps to get a 10 percent discount on vis.The greatwood staff core can hold 125 vis, the silverwood staff can hold 250 vis, the obsidian staff can hold 175 vis, the blaze staff can hold 175 vis, the reed staff can hold 175 vis, the ice staff can hold 175 vis, the quartz staff can hold 175 vis, and the bone staff can hold 175 vis.

Magic Mirrors allow you to transport items between two places. To do so, place one mirror on the wall, and right click it with another mirror in your hand to link them. Then place the other mirror on another wall. Throw an item in the mirror to transport it.
Essentia Mirrors transport essentia instead of items, but cannot work with tubes.

Hand Mirrors allow you to transport items to a linked magic mirror, no matter where you are. Link the hand mirror by right clicking it on a Magic Mirror. You cannot pull items out of the mirror, however.
Summons Fire Bats to fight enemies for you. They will explode after a short amount of time. You must be right clicking while looking at a mob to summon the Hell Bats.

If you throw 1 iron nugget into a crucible with two metallum essentia, you will get 3 iron nuggets in return, effectivly making infinite iron. (Side Note: You can also do this with gold nuggets. You'll need lucrum in addition to metallum.)

Allows you to place a protective ward, or barrier, on a block. So it cannot be broken by anyone! (Including yourself!) Right click to place the ward, and right click it again to remove it. (Default Key)

The Thaumostatic Harness is Thaumcraft's version of a jetpack. It is not quite as good as a Flux-Infused Jetplate from Simply Jetpacks, but it will get you in the air fast. It requires a jar of perditio which you can place in it by right clicking. Press H (default key) to activate it. While it's activated, the harness will slowly drain the perditio. You can use a Thermostatic Girdle to make the Harness better. The Girdle is worn as a bauble.

The Amulet of Vis Storage can store extra vis, effectivley allowing you to carry more vis with you. Place it on a wand recharge pedestal near vis relays so it can charge up. Place it in the amulet bauble slot to be able to use the vis it has stored.
Use your Thaumonomicon for more info.
Clay Golems are fireproof. Use your Thaumonomicon for more info.
Use your Thaumonomicon for more info.
Use your Thaumonomicon for more info.
Any Golem who walks over the Golem Fetter when it is powered with a redstone signal will stop what they are doing immediately and stand still. Unpower the Fetter to have the golems resume work.
Use your Thaumonomicon for more info.
Use your Thaumonomicon for more info.

You can make any golem into an advanced golem through infusion. It is always the same recipe, no matter what type of golem you use. Advanced Golems can have one additional upgrade, move faster, and see further.

All that you have been working on in Thaumcraft has been leading towards this! The final Thaumcraft quest. Ever since Thaumcraft has been installed into the pack, evil flux has been tainting your world. You might have even noticed some when you were crafting. As you're reading this now, Flux has consumed many biomes around your world and is continuing to spread! It is now your job to rid your world of flux using the flux scrubber and aer vis for the fuel. Now quick! Before it's too late!
Craft the Origins of Darkness. It will help guide you through taking over the world. It is important to note to not follow the recipes shown in the book. Check NEI first.

Explore your world to find a Dark Temple. You will know you have found one if there is an Enviromental Accumulator in the center of it. Be sure NOT TO MINE IT though. Side effects of using this machine include mostly negative things to both you and the area surrounding it.
Contain rain by dropping a Weather Container on an Environmental Accumulator when it is raining or snowing outside. Throw it at a wall or the floor to release the rain again.

Drop a Weather Container onto an Environmental Accumulator. This will perform a ritual which will store the current weather of the surrounding area. Throw the bottle at a wall or the floor to release the weather back into the air.

Drop a Biome Extractor Bottle onto an Environmental Accumulator. This will perform a ritual which will store the biome it is in. Throw the bottle at a wall or the floor to make the surrounding area that biome.
Contain sunshine by dropping a Weather Container on an Environmental Accumulator when it is sunny outside. Throw it at a wall or the floor to release the sunshine again.
Contain a thunderstorm by dropping a Weather Container on an Environmental Accumulator when there is a thunderstorm outside. Throw it at a wall or the floor to release the thunder again.

The broom allows you to have creative-like flying. It is not quite creative flight because it is pretty hard to control, but it does not require fuel of any kind. This quest requires you to craft the broom for it to be completed.

Never seen before: A magic mod that adds a tank that functions like you think a tank should! WOW! Features include: Holding and storing liquids, even when picked up. Shift-right clicking it to auto-export to other containers that can hold fluids.

The Exalted Crafter is just like the Wooden Exalted Crafter, but it also connects to your vanilla ender chest. Not the ender chest from Enderstorage, that's a different ender chest! Again, strike it with lightning somehow to keep it after death.
The Wooden Exalted Crafting Table is a portable crafting table with an internal inventory. If you somehow manage to strike it with lightning, it will stay with you after death.
Spiked plates damage monsters and enemies when they walk over it.

Minicio is the base essence. It is not used to craft any seeds besides Minicio seeds, but it can be upgraded into higher essences which are used in many recipes. Get it by killing mobs or mining minicio ore. You'll need more than a stack of minicio essence for the long haul, but it's a good start.

The Vengeance Ring can give you Speed II, Haste II, Jump Boost III, and Invisibility II when you toggle it with shift-right-click. However, when you have it on your person, some vengeful spirits might appear and attack you.

No, it's not another Thaumcraft focus. This is a laser beam. Holding right-click while the Vengeance Focus is in your hand will shoot out a beam. Point and hold this beam at vengeful mobs to freeze them. This does not work on vengeful SPIRITS. Yes, they're different. Vengeful mobs will look like transparent vanilla mobs. Vengeful spirits look like purple particles.
When vengeful mobs are frozen, you can place a Box of Eternal Cloure near them and it will attempt to capture the mob. WARNING: Right-clicking the box once a mob is captured will release said mob.
The Burning GemStone converts any damage you take from Vengeful Spirits & Mobs into hunger. This means when a vengeful spirit or mob hits you, you won't take any damage, but you will get hungrier.
The Weak Infusion Stone changes minicio essence into accio essence, the next tier.
Accio is the second tier of essence. It is used to craft several seeds among other accio based items.

Blood Extractor. Place it in your inventory and kill mobs both friendly and hostile. It will collect their blood as you kill. 1,000 MB equals 1 bucket bucket which you can place by right clicking the extractor on the floor. Like the Dark Tank, you can expand its capacity by combining it with another Blood Extractor. You can do the same by combining it with a Dark Tank.

You may have noticed liquid blood dries up after a short amount of time. Lighting this block on fire will turn it into Hardened Blood Shards, which are used in some recipes. It can also work as a red dye substitute. To keep it in its liquid state, there needs to be some kind of precipitation. *cough* *cough* weather container *cough* *cough*
You can also throw Dark Gems into a blood pool of at least 5 source blocks to form Powered Gems, which are used in several recipes.
The Blood Infusion Core is an item used in many recipes for blood related items.

The Blood Chest can repair tools and weapons you put in it. There is also a rare side-effect of it putting bad effects on the tools like the Breaking enchantment, which causes tools to lose durability faster.

The Blood Infuser allows you to automate the creation of Power Gems. It needs blood, not RF, to run. Fill it with blood by right clicking it with a blood bucket in hand. Alternatively, you can place a blood item in the slot on the left side of the Blood Infuser to fill it with blood. Dark gems and blocks will slowly be transformed into their power variant in this machine. The Blood Infuser is also a crafting machine and has many useful quality of life recipes.
Grow and harvest an undead sapling. It's wood will come in very useful later on.
A bowl of empty promises can be filled with crushed dark gems. This is the first step in upgrading the blood infuser.

pages:9.0:8: I promise I will not make any recipes difficult in Questing Mayhem.

betterquesting:10.desc:8: Infuse a bowl of promises with blood to give it strength 0. This item is used to craft the first machine upgrade.

pages:9.0:8: Just kidding. I don't have the strength right now to write another witty "promise."

betterquesting:10.desc:8: Strength I.

pages:9.0:8: tl:dr is a wonderful saying which simplifies a rather already small saying which provides an excellent example of commentary on our society today. The term "tl:dr," of course, is abbreviated to the phrase "to long:did not read" reffering to a passage,
pages:9.1:8: usually of text, which is so great in length one may not want to read all of the words, most of the time provide the details of the message, in order to get the meaning and core of the message being spoken, or in this case, typed out on a computer or
pages:9.2:8: electronic using a keyboard. Instead, a reader just wants to know the exact and most important information from a passage, as mentioned before, usually of text, in usually only a few words or in some rarer cases, a few sentences. It, in my personal and
pages:9.3:8: unprofessional opinion, shows that readers of the 21st century, and in the general, readers of today in 2019, specifically the 12th of July in the year 2019, for that is when this message is being typed on a computer, although alternatively, I could have
pages:9.4:8: typed, could be typing, or type this message on a mobile electronic device with a keyboard as I have one of the aforementioned devices to my left sitting quietly on my desk not being used, do not care, or what I believe to be the more probable explanation
pages:9.5:8: of why people so often request a "tl:dr" message, or "too long:didn't read" message if you prefer, and quite honestly why the aforementioned term, both in its abbreviated and elongated form, the ladder of which most would consider to be its proper form,
pages:9.6:8: although the first form is, from my personal observations, used more often than the elongated form in today's society, people are generally and simply too lazy to read all of the words in a piece of text, for tl:dr messages are usually requested after a
pages:9.7:8: long string, or perhaps even a passage of, text. Today's audience wants to know only the simple and condensed meaning and message of a story or piece of information. This could, and will almost certainly, have serious and in my personal opinion
pages:9.8:8:
negative effects on today's society going forward, but I digress.







tl:dr - tl:dr stands for "too long, didn't read."

betterquesting:10.desc:8: Strength II.
Strength III.
The blood infuser needs this upgrade in order to make the next tier of bowl of promises. Upgrades the tank capacity of x2.
The blood infuser needs this upgrade in order to make the next tier of bowl of promises. Upgrades the tank capacity of x4.
The blood infuser needs this upgrade in order to make the next tier of bowl of promises. Upgrades the tank capacity of x8.
Increases the speed of the machine x2.
It looks cool. Make it.
A crafting ingredient in a few recipes.
The Kineticator pulls items towards you from a short range. Must be charged in the blood infuser. Shift right-click to toggle.
The Repelling Kineticator pushes items away from you. Must be charged in the blood infuser. Shift right-click to toggle.

A sanguinary pedestal will automatically extract the blood from nearby blood-stained blocks. You can use this ability to automatically collect blood. It will automatically output to touching tanks and pipes.

A sanguinary pedestal made from Dark Power Gems will automatically extract the blood from nearby blood stained blocks faster than its predecessor. You can use this ability to automatically collect blood. It will automatically output to touching tanks and pipes.
Removes the negative effects your tools might obtain from the blood chest. Given you provide it with blood.
Does what the quest title sounds like. Replace the gold ingot in the middle of the crafting recipe with another chalice to extend the network that chalice in the crafting table is connected to.

The colossal blood chest is a much bigger version of the blood chest. It is a multiblock of 25 reinforced undead planks in a hollow cube. The final block is a colossal blood chest block, which can be placed anywhere in the multiblock. Its blood usage is much higher than the standard blood chest, but the blood cost decreases the more items you have in there at once.

Remember the quest for finding a Dark Temple? Remember how I told you not to break the Environmental Accumulator? Yeah? Well now I'm telling you to break the Environmental Accumulator. This will give you an Environmental Accumulator Core, which is an ingredient in the Sanguinary Environmental Accumulator. This machine acts just like the Environmental Accumulator at the Dark Temples, but it can run on blood and has no bad effects on the enviroment. However, this machine requires much more blood than the regular Environmental Accumulator. You will need to surround the machine with 8 tanks of blood. (See the picture in the Origins of Darkness book for an example & more info.)
A reusable ender pearl. Uses blood. Charge in blood infuser.
When this pendant is in your inventory, it will remove any bad effects you have at the cost of some blood. Charge in blood infuser.

This pendant will give you a potion effect of your choice. Simply right click and put the potion you want inside the GUI. Different effects cost more blood than others to use. Charge in blood infuser.
When placed anywhere in your inventory, this ring will allow you to jump higher, walk faster, and move more quickly up blocks. All in all, a great ring to have.
You'll need some potions to put in your Primed Pendant.
Single use. Summons thunder on right click.
Has fortune 10, can mine at diamond level, and might have a side-effect of summoning spirits. Other than that, it's a normal pickaxe.§4§5
Special torches that will stop spirits from spawning in the area. Spirits can, however, walk into the area unharmed.
Apparently, all we need to do to solve world hunger is eat humanoid flesh soaked in blood! Try it! It's infinite food, right? Amazing!
When you kill monsters with this sword, you will get more blood from them than if you killed them with any other sword.

Holding right click will charge a circle around you. When you release, any mobs, good or bad, will be brutally pushed back. Shift-right-click to cycle through the levels of power. The higher the level, the more damage is dealt, the further mobs are pushed back, and the more blood is used.

Instead of pushing mobs back, when you hold and release right click, this mace will cause an explosion affecting blocks and mobs around you. The explosion will not harm you. Shift right click to cycle through the levels of power. The higher the level, the bigger the explosion, and the more blood is used. Charge in Blood Infuser.
Slightly better than golden caps.
The Regular Infusion Stone changes accio essence into crucio essence, the next tier.
Crucio is the third tier of essence. It is used to craft several seeds among other crucio based items.
Produces minicio. Can be upgraded using Agricraft.
The Strong Infusion Stone changes crucio essence into imperio essence, the next tier.
Imperio is the forth tier of essence. It is used to craft several seeds among other imperio based items.
The Extreme Infusion Stone changes imperio essence into zivicio essence, the final tier.
Zivicio is the final tier of essence! It is used to craft several seeds among other zivicio based items.

Accio armour, tools, and more! When crafting the accio furnace, any BOTANIA flower will work, even if it does not say so in NEI. For the seed pouch, you will need to complete the thaumcraft research for the focus bag in order to see its recipe.
Accio ingots are a crafting ingredient in many accio related items.
Crucio ingots are a crafting ingredient in many crucio related items.
Imperio ingots are a crafting ingredient in many imperio related items.

Crucio armour, tools, and more! When crafting the crucio furnace, any BOTANIA flower will work, even if it does not say so in NEI. For the seed pouch, you will need to complete the thaumcraft research for the focus bag in order to see its recipe.
Zivicio ingots are a crafting ingredient in many zivicio related, end-game items.

Imperio armour, tools, and more! When crafting the imperio furnace, any BOTANIA flower will work, even if it does not say so in NEI. For the seed pouch, you will need to complete the thaumcraft research for the focus bag in order to see its recipe.

Zivicio armour, tools, and more! When crafting the zivicio furnace, any BOTANIA flower will work, even if it does not say so in NEI. For the seed pouch, you will need to complete the thaumcraft research for the focus bag in order to see its recipe.
Produces water essence which makes some things related to water. Remember to upgrade the stats of the seeds using agricraft.
Coal seeds produce coal essence which makes coal. Remember to upgrade the stats of the seeds using agricraft.
Produces rubber essence which makes raw rubber.
Produces fire essence which makes some things related to fire.
Produces technicolor essence which makes all vanilla dyes.
That title actually makes logical sense..... anyway.... Produces nature essence which makes all vanillia nature things.
Produces earth essence which makes most vanilla blocks you find on earth.
Produces air essence which makes some things related to air.
Produces nether essence which makes materials you would find in the nether (besides glowstone).
Produces lead essence which makes lead ore.
Produces obsidian essence which makes obsidian.
Produces sheep essence which makes raw mutton.
Produces tin essence which makes tin ore.
Produces copper essence which makes copper ore.
Produces glowstone essence which makes glowstone.
Produces redstone essence which makes redstone.
Produces bronze essence which makes bronze ingots.
Produces pig essence which makes raw pork, hambone, bacon, and many bacon products.
Produces cow essence which makes leather, raw beef, and milk. Remember to upgrade the stats of the seeds using agricraft.
Produces aluminium essence which makes aluminium ore.
Produces certus quartz essence which makes certus quartz ore as well as Applied Energistics 2 presses and pure certus quartz crystals.
Produces chicken essence which makes eggs, raw chicken, and feathers.
Produces manasteel essence which makes manasteel ingots.
Produces saltpeter essence which makes saltpeter.
Produces amber essence which makes amber.
Produces quicksilver essence which makes quicksilver drops.
Produces sulfur essence which makes sulfur.
Produces iron essence which makes iron ore.
Produces experience essence which makes bottles of enchanting.
The Lexica Botania book has all of the info you need for Botania.

You can find flowers from Botania growing on the ground. Using floral fertilizer like bonemeal on grass will also spawn only Botania flowers. Collect them and turn them into mystical petals. There are 16.
Craft a wand of the forest. The colors are determined by the color of the petals you used to craft the wand. This wand is very important when dealing with mana. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Produces gold essence which makes gold ore.
A magical block that is used to craft flowers and other useful magical items. Make sure to fill the apothecary with water. To craft using the petal apothecary, simply throw in the required items.
Use the mana pool to turn items into other items. Each craft requires a specific amount of mana in the mana pool.

The pure daisy is an important and powerful flower in botania. Use it to make livingwood and livingrock, common ingredients for crafting, by placing logs and stone around the daisy. Logs make livingwood, stone makes livingrock.

Use mana spreaders to transport and distribute mana. You can use your wand of the forest to link your mana spreaders to mana producers like Nightshades. Right click your wand of the forest to the mana spreader and then whatever you want to link to the mana spreader to link. You can also use your wand of the forest to have the mana "spread" to a mana consumer like a mana pool. Remember, the mana must always go through a mana spreader, you can't have mana go from a Nightshade to a Mana Pool. It has to go from the Nightshade, to the Mana Spreader, to the Mana Pool. Use your lexica botania for more info.
Produces mana by eating cake. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Generates mana passively during night. Will decay in 3 in-game days. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Generates mana passively through nearby water sources. Will decay in in-game 3 days. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Produces mana through eating edibles on the floor. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Produces mana by eating nearby colored wool. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Produces mana through cellular blocks placed within a 25x25 area around it. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Generates mana by burning vanilla fuels. Simply drop a burnable vanilla item near the endoflame and it will produce a bit of mana. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Generates mana passively through sunlight. Will decay in 3 in-game days. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Thermalilies produce mana by eating lava source blocks. One source block of lava will fill up their entire internal buffer, so transport the mana fast! Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Produces mana by taking nearby player's XP. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Generates mana by eating nearby leaf blocks. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Produces mana by eating Dayblooms, Nightshades, and Hydroangeas. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Produces mana through TnT explosions. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
Produces mana by killing nearby slime entities. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.
You can transform some vanilla items into mana-infused varients. Simply drop the base item into the mana pool, and you will have the mana version.

The runic altar is used to craft many items in Botania. Similar to the mana pool, drop the required items on to the altar. Make sure the altar has mana by linking it with a mana spreader. You will know when you have the recipe correct. When the recipe is correct, drop a piece of livingrock onto the altar, let the recipe "charge," and then right click the altar with your wand of the forest.
Runes are crafted on the Runic Altar. Among many more, there is a Water Rune, a Fire Rune, an Earth Rune, and an Air Rune. Runes are used in many recipes.
There are Runes for every season; Winter, Spring, Summer, and Autumn. The recipes for these Runes include some Elemental Runes.
The final Runes have somewhat more complex recipes.
Flattens land by adding or removing dirt to/from the area. Uses a bit of mana per use.
Place this block next to a mana pool or furnace. It will increase the mana output rate of mana pools. If you place it next to a furnace, it will increase the efficiency of the furnace.
When worn as a bauble, it turns water source blocks into ice. The ice will only last while the player is in the area.
When worn as a bauble, you will swim faster, walk underwater faster, and see underwater better.
When worn as a bauble, you will be able to run faster, jump higher, and fall from greater heights. You will also have step-assist.
Creates dirt on right-click. Requires a bit of mana per use.
Produces lapis lazuli essence which makes lapis lazuli ore.
Creates water on right-click. Uses a bit of mana per use.
Throws the player 35 blocks in the air on right-click. Uses a bit of mana per use.
Will produce a ring of fire around the player. Uses some mana per use.

Smelts blocks on right click. The rod will only smelt blocks and the blocks must be able to smelt into another block. For example, if you try to use the rod on gold ore, the gold ore will stay gold ore and not turn into a gold ingot. However, if you use the rod on cobblestone, the cobblestone will turn into smooth stone. Uses a bit of mana per use.
Similar to the Rod of the Lands. Will create cobblestone on right-click. Uses a bit of mana per use.
Produces quartz essence which makes quartz and pure nether quartz crystals.
26,070 Ludicrite Blocks in 1 Item

Crafting Terrestrial Agglomeration Plates is the first step in creating terrasteel. Place one Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate in the middle of a lapis and livingrock checkerboard. See the setup in your Lexica Botania, you can also click "visualize" for more help.
The Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate requires mana. The most efficient method of getting mana to the plate, according to the book, are sparks. Use the Lexica Botania for more info.

Throwing 1 Manasteel, 1 Manapearl, and 1 Mana Diamond on the Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate will start the ritual for Terrasteel. Remember, if you pick up any of the items, the ritual will cancel. The ritual also requires half a mana pool. Using multiple sparks are recommended, but using at least one pair of sparks is a necessity.
Like all other metal blocks in Minecraft, 9 ingots are required to make one block. Oh, you think this is hard... heh-he. ;)
You read it correctly. Just be thankful I didn't say "Terrasteel Block x64."

Some miscellaneous items you can craft with elven items. To learn more about each individual item, search them in the index of the Lexica Botania or see the recipe for an item and click the right arrow at the top. Alright, now before continuing with the description, look at the recipes for all of the items in detail. Done? Okay, now let's answer the elephant in the room. Yes. In order to craft some of these items, you will have to travel to outer space once more. Specifically, travel to the planet Kepler 22b. I know you think I said back in the HQM book, in the last quest for Galacticraft that Eris was the last required planet you have to go to by saying "put on your space suit one last time," but if you take a look back at that description, you'll notice the word "'final'" has quotation marks around it, implying the term "final" is really relative.. This will be your "final" required space mission.

Alfheim is a dimension of mystical elves. You can create a portal to alfheim, but it will not be strong enough for you to visit in person. However, you can throw items through the portal and the elves may give you something in return. The portal requires 8 livingwood, 3 glimmering livingwood, 1 elven gateway core, 2 manapools, and 2 pylons. Read the Lexica Botania for more info and to view the setup. After you create the portal, it is recommended you throw the Lexica Botania book through the portal to gain extra knowledge.

Throw 2 manasteel through the portal to get 1 elementium. Throw living wood through the portal to get dreamwood. Throw mana pearls through to get pixie dust. Throw mana diamond through to get dragonstone. Throw managlass through to get Alfglass.
Produces creeper essence which makes gunpowder, music discs, and creeper heads.
Produces enderman essence which makes enderpearls, endstone, or enderman heads.

There are 3 drums in Botania. The drum of the wild harvests tall grass, flowers, and crops in a 25x25x7 area when supplied with a mana burst. The drum of the canopy harvests leaves in a 24 block diameter and 7 block height. Leaves drop items as if a hand broke them. The drum of gathering shears nearby sheep. It will also fill buckets with milk if the bucket is under a cow. To give the drums mana, you must use a mana pulse spreader or mana blaster. A regular mana spreader will not work.
You have already traded with the elves, but you might need some more items.
Creates magical bridges when right-clicked. Uses a bit of mana per use.
Produces blaze essence which makes blaze rods.

There are 3 horns in Botania. The horn of the wild removes nearby grass and flowers from the ground. Horn of the canopy removes nearby leaves. Horn of the covering removes nearby snow from the ground.
Produces ardite essence which makes ardite ore.
Basic tools & weapons you can make with manasteel.
Basic tools & weapons you can make with terrasteel. There are different ranks on the terra shatterer. These ranks do not affect this quest, you can submit any ranked terra shatterer.
Produces skeleton essence which makes bones, skeleton heads, music discs, and ham bones.
Produces slime essence which makes slimeballs.
A chestplate made out of manasteel. Gives 3 points of armour. When the entire manasteel set is worn, mana cost on tools and rods is reduced by 10 percent.
Leggings made out of manasteel. Gives 2.5 points of armour. When the entire manasteel set is worn, mana cost on tools and rods is reduced by 10 percent.
Boots made out of manasteel. Gives 1 point of armour. When the entire manasteel set is worn, mana cost on tools and rods is reduced by 10 percent.

A helmet made out of Terrasteel. Gives 1.5 points of armour. When the entire terrasteel set is worn, you will receive the will of the ancients (passive mana generation, mana cost on tools and rods will decrease by 20 percent, passive regeneration when hunger bar is not full, all wills dropped by the Guardian of Gaia ON HARD MODE)

A chestplate made out of Terrasteel. Gives 4 armour points. When the entire terrasteel set is worn, you will receive the will of the ancients (passive mana generation, mana cost on tools and rods will decrease by 20 percent, passive regeneration when hunger bar is not full, all wills dropped by the Guardian of Gaia ON HARD MODE)

Leggings made out of Terrasteel. Gives 3 armour points. When the entire terrasteel set is worn, you will receive the will of the ancients (passive mana generation, mana cost on tools and rods will decrease by 20 percent, passive regeneration when hunger bar is not full, all wills dropped by the Guardian of Gaia ON HARD MODE)

Boots made out of Terrasteel. Gives 1.5 armour points. When the entire terrasteel set is worn, you will receive the will of the ancients (passive mana generation, mana cost on tools and rods will decrease by 20 percent, passive regeneration when hunger bar is not full, all wills dropped by the Guardian of Gaia ON HARD MODE)

Boots made out of elementium. Gives 1 armour point. Gives an 11 percent chance to spawn a pixie after the player has been attacked. The pixie will go after the attacker. The chance stacks with each piece of elementium armour. When the entire elementium set is worn, the player will recieve the Great Fairy's Blessing. (decreases mana cost on tools & rods by 10 percent, pixies near the player will get a random potion effect.)

Leggings made out of elementium. Gives 2.5 armour points. Gives an 11 percent chance to spawn a pixie after the player has been attacked. The pixie will go after the attacker. The chance stacks with each piece of elementium armour. When the entire elementium set is worn, the player will recieve the Great Fairy's Blessing. (decreases mana cost on tools & rods by 10 percent, pixies near the player will get a random potion effect.)

A chestplate made out of elementium. Gives 3 points of armour. Gives an 11 percent chance to spawn a pixie after the player has been attacked. The pixie will go after the attacker. The chance stacks with each piece of elementium armour. When the entire elementium set is worn, the player will recieve the Great Fairy's Blessing. (decreases mana cost on tools & rods by 10 percent, pixies near the player will get a random potion effect.)

A helmet made out of elementium. Gives 1 armour point. Gives an 11 percent chance to spawn a pixie after the player has been attacked. The pixie will go after the attacker. The chance stacks with each piece of elementium armour. When the entire elementium set is worn, the player will recieve the Great Fairy's Blessing. (decreases mana cost on tools & rods by 10 percent, pixies near the player will get a random potion effect.)
A helmet made out of manasteel. Gives 1 point of armour. When the entire manasteel set is worn, mana cost on items and rods is reduced by 10 percent
Produces spider essence which makes string and spider eyes.

The Guardian Of Gaia is a boss you can summon. To summon the Guardian Of Gaia, you must place 4 Gaia Pylons around an activated beacon and right-click the beacon with an ingot of terrasteel. The Guardian will spawn and a border will form around the pylons, making it so you can't escape. The battle is intended to be very hard, so don't do it unless you're ready. If you kill the Guardian Of Gaia, it will drop Gaia spirits which are used for several crafts as well as advancing forward in Botania.

To summon the hard version of the Guardian of Gaia, the same setup is used, but you click the beacon with a Gaia Spirit Ingot instead of a terrasteel ingot. The hard mode of the Gaia Guardian fight is much harder than the original, hence the name. This time, the Guardian has 15 extra armour points, can teleport every 2.25 seconds in stage 2 and every 1.75 seconds in stage 3, launches magic missiles, creates an extra trap in stage 3, and wither skeletons now hold elementium swords. Definitely a lot to handle. If you manage to defeat the Guardian Of Gaia in hard mode, you will be rewarded with more gaia spirits and a dice of fate. You may even win some more items if you're lucky!
Produces ghast essence which makes ghast tears.
Basic tools & weapons you can make with elementium.
Blasts mana on right click. Can be used to give blocks and flowers mana. Requires the player to have a mana tablet with some mana in it.
Slowly creates mana when in a player's inventory. All mana will go into the player's mana tablet. Mana tablet required.
Will replace blocks in a 7x7 area with another block. Shift-right-click on a block to select the block you want.
Will charm hostile mobs and make them attack another enemy instead of you. There must be another enemy around in order to work though.
Teleports items to a specific location.
Keeps mobs and animals near the flower.
Makes nearby mobs fight each other.
Kills nearby mobs

Miscellaneous items that you can make with Gaia Spirits. For info on all of the items, seach them up in the Lexica Botania index. Now, look at all the recipes in detail. Okay, to once again address the elephant in the room.. yes. Travel to Kepler 22b once again please if you didn't already collect enough materials there when you were there a few quests ago. If that is you.... hahahha. Don't worry, this will be your last trip to space (?).
Poisons mobs.
Feeds nearby animals and makes them breed.
Fuels nearby furnaces with mana.
Makes nearby dropped items unaffected from the ring of magnetization.
Makes endermen teleport to the flower.
Heals nearby players.
Places blocks on another specified block.
Collects nearby items on the ground and places them into a nearby inventory, like a chest.
Creates an air bubble underwater.
Prevents creepers from exploding. Also makes creepers run away from players.
Speeds up plant growth
Turns nearby netherrack into nether ores. (For example, nether quartz, nether coal ore, nether copper ore, and nether lapis ore) Must be planted on dirt or grass in the Nether.
Kills adult animals.
Turns nearby stone into overworld ores. (for example, diamond ore, iron ore, and gold ore.)
Generates mystical flowers.
Makes nearby mobs slow.
Keeps mobs away from wherever it is placed.
Turns nearby stone into decorative stone from Botania.
Makes monsters stronger.
Pushes dropped items in a specified direction.
Turns sand into clay.

The mana tablet is a way of transporting mana. If you throw it in a mana pool, it will gather mana in its internal storage. Tools & rods that require mana will use the mana tablet's mana before anything else.

Produces cobalt essence which makes cobalt ore.

This is one of the most resource intensive items in all of Questing Mayhem. It is not the most intensive, however, because it is used in several end game recipes. Surprise surprise! You're in the End Game now, so prepare to make a lot of these and use them in recipes in the future. For now, just make one. Here's some facts about The Eternal Singularity, though. 30,570 Iron Blocks, 27,750 Gold Blocks, 30, 750 Lapis Lazuli Blocks, 32, 250 Redstone Blocks, 29,250 Nether Quartz Blocks, 30,750 Copper Blocks, 30,750 Tin Blocks, 29,250 Lead Blocks, 29,250 Silver Blocks, 30,750 Nickel Blocks, 27,000 Clay Balls, 25,750 Shiny Blocks, 25,125 Mana Infused Blocks, 26,250 Signalum Blocks, 26,100 Lumium Blocks, 25, 875 Enderium Blocks, 26,130 Aluminum Blocks, 26,100 Bronze Blocks, 26,160 Electrum Blocks, 26,175 Invar Blocks, 25,905 Magnesium Blocks, 26,070 Steel Blocks, 25,935 Tungsten Blocks, 25,875 Uranium Blocks, 25,890 Zinc Blocks, 26,070 Aluminum Brass Blocks, 26,010 Alumite Blocks, 26,040 Ardite Blocks, 25,755 Cobalt Blocks, 25,860 Solid Ender Blocks, 25,845 Manyullyn Blocks, 25,725 Conductive Iron Blocks, 26,115 Electrical Steel Blocks, 25,995 Energetic Alloy Blocks, 25,905 Dark Steel Blocks, 25,860 Pulsating Iron Blocks, 26,085 Redstone Alloy Blocks, 25,845 Soularium Blocks, 25,860 Vibrant Alloy Blocks, 26,175 Blue Gem Blocks, 25,740 Carbon Blocks, 25,920 Crystal Blocks,
26,145 Palladium Blocks, 25,770 Red Gem Blocks, 25,800 White Gem Blocks, 25,770 Blutonium Blocks, 26,040 Cyanite Blocks, 26,160 Graphite Blocks, 26,070 Ludicrite Blocks, 25,875 Yellorium Blocks, 26,100 Coal Blocks, 25,965 Emerald Blocks, 25,890 Diamond Blocks, 26,100 Fairy Blocks, 25,815 Pokefennium Blocks, & 25,755 Unstable Ingot Blocks are in this one item.
