This is a very powerful item and acts as the first powerful item in ProjectE in Questing Mayhem. It can change several different blocks and items into other blocks and items in recipes. It can also change items and blocks to its varieties through in world crafting. For instance, if you right-click grass with the Philosopher's Stone in hand, it will turn into cobblestone. The same is true for saplings. If something can be changed in-world with the Philosopher's Stone, the item it can change into will appear in the top left hand corner of your screen when you hover over the block or item with the Philosopher's Stone.
Cosmic Meatballs have two of each meat type in it and is used in Xtreme crafting.
Mobius fuel is used in some extreme crafting recipes and can smelt items in a furnace for 16x longer than coal.
Aeternalis fuel is used in many extreme crafting recipes and can smelt items in a furnace for 64x longer than coal.

Ultimate Stew has almost every fruit, vegetable, grain, gourd, spice, or food-like plant in it and is used in Xtreme crafting. But that shouldn't be a problem for you since you completed the farming with pam questline about a year ago? Right?
The Endest Pearl is NOT a reusable ender pearl. I repeat. It is not a reusable ender pearl. It's more like a bomb... throw it to see what I mean.

A more expensive crafting ingredient used in other recipes. It also has its own set of armour and tools which are even more powerful than dark matter. Like Dark Matter, you will notice NEI shows 45 different crafting recipes for Red Matter. The only difference between these recipes are the singularities used. Any and every singularity can be used to craft Red Matter.

An expensive crafting ingredient used in many recipes. It also has its own set of armour and tools which are very powerful. When crafting, you will notice NEI shows 45 different crafting recipes for Dark Matter. The only difference between these recipes are the singularities used. Any and every singularity can be used to craft Dark Matter.
Previously mentioned Red Matter Armour, Tools, and more.
Previously mentioned Dark Matter Armour, Tools, and more.
It can display a stack of items. Yep... 20 dark matter and 4 red matter to display some items.

This machine converts light to EMC, a currency used to convert blocks and items into other blocks and items. The light can be natural (like sunlight) or produced by you (like placing a jack-o-lantern near it). It can also work without light in the nether. Place some specific items into the machine to convert it to another specific item using some of the collector's stored EMC. Place Klein Stars in it to fill them with EMC.
Acts the same as the Energy Collector MK1, but has a larger internal storage for items and EMC. It also produces EMC faster than the Energy Collector MK1.
Acts the same as the Energy Collector MK1 and Energy Collector MK2, but has a larger internal storage for items and EMC. It also produces EMC faster than the Energy Collector MK2.
Doesn't really have anything to do with alchemy. It's just a large chest that can hold 104 stacks of items.

When placed in the Alchemical Chest, the Repair Talisman will gradually and peacefully repair any damaged item in the chest. It repairs 1 durability every second. So I guess the Alchemical Chest does have some "alchemical" uses after all.
When placed in the Alchemical Chest, the Black Hole Band will pull nearby items into the alchemical chest.

All of these rings affect their surroundings in some way when they are placed on a dark matter pedestal. They also have different functions when they are not on the pedestal.

The Archangel Ring fires a stream of arrows when its user right clicks it in their hand or when it is toggled on with a keybind. On the pedestal, it fires arrows at nearby mobs every 2 seconds.

The Harvest Goddess Band accelerates crop growth near it to the point where 1 seed will be fully grown within seconds. This is true when it is held by a player and on a pedestal. When activated with a keybind, the band will also automatically harvest fully grown crops.

The Ignition Ring, when activated, sets the wielder's surroundings on fire. On a pedestal, when activated, the ring will also set nearby mobs on fire.

The Zero Ring will freeze the wielder's surroundings when activated or the user right clicks with it in hand. On a pedestal, when activated, the ring will also put out nearby mobs that are on fire.

It should be noted that all of these rings need fuel to work correctly. They use EMC items or burnables as coal. So acceptable fuels include klein stars with EMC stored in them, coal, alchemical coal, or other alchemical fuels. The fuels must be in the player's inventory.

There are two types of alchemical amulets. An Evertide Amulet and a Volcanite Amulet. The Evertide Amulet is essentially a Water Amulet and the Volcanite Amulet is essentially a Fire Amulet. 

What are amulets? Well, if you read their tool tips, you would find that they can place water and lava respectively and that they are essentially reusable buckets of water and lava. You would also find out that the Water Amulet can throw a water projectile with a keybind and that the Fire Amulet can throw a fire projectile with a keybind. Finally, you would see that the Evertide Amulet does not require any fuel. However, the Volcanite Amulet consumes 32 EMC from a Klein Star or equivalent per use.
"Crafting Ingredient."
A portable Alchemical Chest. You have to make the white bag first as that is the only craftable color. After that, you can dye the bag to any color you like.
The Nova Catalyst acts like a really big bomb.
The Nova Cataclysm acts like an even larger bomb. Be careful, though. The explosion scatters.

Right click the destruction catalyst in a safe area that you don't mind destroying. On right click, it will destroy a large part of the area you pointed out. You can increase the range by pressing the appropriate key (default key is V). Like the Nova Catalyst and Nova Catalysm, all of the blocks it destroys will compile into one item which you can pickup. All of the items will appear in a Matter Cluster.

Almost every item and block in the game has EMC. You can find an item's EMC value by looking at the tooltip. Put any item with EMC in the top left corner of the Energy Condenser. Any other items with EMC that are placed anywhere else in the Condenser will try to convert the items to the item in the left corner. An equivalent amount of EMC is needed to get your desired item.

For example, Cobblestone has an EMC value of 1 and Obsidian has an EMC value of 64. Therefore, if you want to turn your Cobblestone into Obsidian, 64 Cobblestone will need to be placed in the Condenser to make 1 Obsidian. The progress of transmutation can be seen at the top of the Condenser.

There is certainly a recipe for this item and this item is certainly used in many extreme crafting recipes. You may want to make several batches at a time.

Notice that a player head is required for the recipe. A player head can be crafted using Botanical means. Check the Lexica Botania index for more information.

The Dire Autocrafting Table allows you to set a schematic in the right hand side for the item you want to craft. Put the appropriate resources in the left once you have set the pattern and the item will be crafted automatically. The items on the right don't need to be any order, so there is no more need to look back at NEI 50 times for each recipe.

The place to put items you want to convert and the place where your desired items go have now been separated. Put any item you want to change on the left, your desired item in the top left corner, and the output will appear on the right side.
Not what you expect
Place down and right-click to have something interesting happen.

When you started playing Questing Mayhem, you may have turned Hardcore Questing Mode Hardcore mode on or Better Questing Hardcore mode on. You would have had 3 lives to start with, meaning if you died 3 times without any extra lives, that would be game over.

As you probably noticed, especially if you've been playing hardcore mode, there are very few opportunities to get extra lives. The repeatable killing monsters quests all the way back in the first questline was the most reliable source of hearts. 

Now that you have the Infinity Catalyst, though, you can craft quarter hearts! There's a recipe for the Hardcore Questing Mode quarter heart and you can craft those hearts into Better Questing hearts. Finally, you can have as many lives as you want (as long as you don't want more than 255 lives).

Now, for those of you who are not playing in Hardcore mode, you still need to complete this quest. Think of it as your punishment for not completing one of the grindiest packs ever on a harder difficulty. I mean... I guess you don't have to do this, but it would mean you won't be able to fully 100% complete Questing Mayhem and nobody wants that, right?

Place any item with EMC on the left side or in the box with the flame. The table will "learn" the item and it will appear on the right. Learn other items to increase the table's internal EMC storage which you can see in the bottom left hand corner. You can take items out of the right hand side at the cost of the table's EMC storage.

For example, cobblestone has an EMC value of 1 and obsidian has an EMC value of 64. Therefore, if you want to take out 1 piece of obsidian from the table (assuming you have learned it) and still keep the EMC value of the obsidian, 64 cobblestone will need to be placed into the table. 

To "unlearn" an item, place it in the box with the crossed out book.
A very expensive ingot & crafting ingredient.
A portable Transmutation Table. It has the same inventory and "learned items" as your table.

The Tome of Knowledge, when learned in the Transmutation Table or Tablet, will, in turn, give the Table or Tablet the knowledge of every item and block with EMC in the game. This makes it so you can pull any item with EMC out of your tablet or table granted you have enough EMC.
Acts the same as the Energy Relay MK1 and Energy Relay MK2, but has a larger internal storage for EMC.
Acts the same as the Energy Relay MK1, but has a larger internal storage for EMC.

Put items with EMC into the input and it will be collected, storing the item's EMC in its internal inventory. You can also fill the relay up with EMC by connecting it to an Energy Collector. The EMC collected from the collector will be transfered to the relay. You can extract this EMC by putting a Klein Star in the charging slot.

You can store EMC inside your Applied Energistics system. No, I don't mean by storing items with EMC like you would normally (although you can do that). You can convert items into EMC "energy" and put that "energy" into your ME system.

The EMC Condenser should be connected to your ME system. Insert items by means of a hopper or pipe into the condenser and EMC crystals will appear in your ME System. These crystals will have the same amount of EMC as you've put into your condenser. There are different sizes of the crystals as to not take up storage space in your cells. 

There is a catch, however. There are 4 tiers of EMC condensers and each one (besides the ultimate tier) has a max input of EMC. Tier 1 will only accept items with about 8,000 EMC or lower. The advanced tier will only accept items with about 80,000 EMC. Starting at this tier, the condenser also has redstone control. Right click it with redstone dust to configure redstone capabilities. The improved tier will only accept items with about 800,000 EMC. Starting at this tier, the condenser can put items without EMC into the system. It will not convert items without EMC to EMC, though. The ultimate tier, as mentioned before, has no limit to how much EMC can be inputted.

You could start off small and do the basic first tier. But why would you do that?

Note that the EMC condenser does add to the power your ME system consumes.

This works with the Transmutation Table or Tablet to auto-craft items you have learned in the Table or Tablet. Right click the Alchemical Tome in your hand to link it to your knowledge. Then right click it into the EMC Assembler. Now all of the items you have learned in the Transmutation Table or Tablet can be accessed and crafted using EMC crystals stored in your ME system.

Like the EMC Condenser, the EMC Assembler has 4 different tiers. The basic tier can auto-craft only 1 item at a time. The advanced tier can craft 4 recipes at a time and is faster than the basic tier. The improved assembler can craft 8 recipes at a time and is faster than the advanced tier. The ultimate assembler can craft 16 recipes at a time and is the fastest.

You could start off simple, but why do that?

Check the "Transmutation Table" quest description for more information.

If you're running low on EMC and need things to condense, find items with high EMC values by using the divining rod. When right clicked, it will tell you the average EMC per block in a certain area around you. This will point you in a general direction on where to go in your search for EMC. 

There are 3 tiers. The low tier tells just the average amount of EMC in a certain distance. The medium tier can tell which block has the highest EMC in that distance as well as tell you the average. The high tier can tell the top 3 blocks with the most EMC as well as the average EMC.

Open the GUI by pressing the "Extra Key" keybind for ProjectE (default C). Place a Klein Star with stored EMC in the left slot and place your desired building block in the right. It will use the EMC in the Klein Star to build walls with the desired block, acting like a builder's wand. Change the size by increasing the charge (default key V).

Has infinite durability. Can break anything, including bedrock.

Shift right click it to switch it to "Hammer" mode so it can destroy a very large area.

Has infinite durability. Instantly breaks anything you think a shovel breaks. 

Shift right click it to switch it to "Singularity" mode so it can destroy a very large area.

To be honest, it's not much different from The World Breaker. In fact, it's more like a downgrade. It can't break bedrock. Oh well.
Executes the /kill command on mob (or player) it hits, effectively killing anything in 1 hit.

Has infinite durability. Instantly breaks anything you think an axe breaks. When you break a log with logs on top of it, all of the logs will break. When chopping down a tree, the leaves instantly break once all the logs are gone and drop the normal amount of saplings and apples.

Shift right click it to switch it to turn grass around you to dirt.
All Infinity Tool Parts make any tool they are applied to Unbreakable and Cosmic.
Passively generates mana. It just needs to be placed.

Has infinite durability. It needs 1 arrow to fire, effectively making it has the Infinity enchantment. When an arrow is fired, 10 other arrows will shoot from the sky where the first arrow landed.

It treats all arrows at equal, so there is no use in using Thaumcraft arrows or Tinkers' Construct Arrows.

All of the armor has infinite durability and gives a 20% Vis discount for Thaumcraft when worn. Meaning when doing Thaumcraft with this armor set on, you get an 80% Vis discount in addition to any other Vis discounts.

When worn, The Infinity Helmet keeps the wearer's hunger bar full, meaning the wearer does not need to eat when they have the helmet equipped.

When worn, The Infinity Breastplate makes the wearer immune to any negative staus effect. It also grants the wearer creative flight.

When worn, The Infinity Pants make the wearer immune to lasting fire damage. The wearer will still be hurt when standing in fire (although the damage is significantly reduced), but when they step out of the fire, it will immediately extinguish.

When worn, The Infinity Boots allow the wearer to jump 4 blocks high and run very fast.

When wearing The Infinity Breatplate and The Infinity Boots together, flight speed will be increased.

When The Infinity Set is worn together, the wearer does not take damage and cannot be killed by anything except The Sword of the Cosmos. The wearer will not be knocked back by anything.
Has infinite Aer, Terra, Ignis, Aqua, Ordo, and Perdito vis.

If you are reading this, congratulations! You have completed Questing Mayhem Part 2, the 2nd questbook of the modpack. This is an outstanding accomplishement and you should be very proud of yourself.

There, is that enough of a motivation boost for you? I hope so, because it's not getting any easier from here. Welcome to Part 3 of Questing Mayhem. The 3rd and final Quest Book in Questing Mayhem and it is the "Simple Achievements" book. 

There are more quests and questlines in the Simple Achievements book that you must complete. 

This quest is repeatable, so if you lose the Simple Achievements book, complete this quest again and you will be rewarded with another one.

See the front pages of the Simple Achievements book for more information.
Right-click to obtain 999 Research Points in every aspect of Thaumcraft.

Has 243 slots that can hold 2,147,483,647 items each. That happens to be the same amount of storage per slot as a Deep Storage Unit.

Retains its inventory when picked up.

Welcome! If you are reading this, you have taken your first steps to completing part one and unlocking part two of questing mayhem. Let me explain. This questline contains quests for all of the items at the end of questlines and quest paths thus far. Pretty much, if a quest doesn't unlock anything in the HQM book, it is also here. You must complete this questline to unlock any other questline in the Better Questing book. You might know where I am headed. Therefore, because final quests from HQM make up this questline, YOU MUST COMPLETE EVERY, SINGLE, QUEST IN THE HQM BOOK! It honestly isn't as hard as you probably think. As you go through the HQM questbook, you will also be completing this questline. There is a catch, however. When you complete quests in this questline, it will take the required items out of your inventory, so you will lose those items. Don't worry. You can just make more. ;) There are no rewards given in this questline, so if I were you, I'd just ignore this book until you have 100% completed your HQM book. The quests in this questline are organized by what questline they are located at in the HQM questbook. No matter which order you complete the quests, you will still have to complete every quest in the questline and every quest in HQM. Don't worry, it's worth it.... maybe. Good luck! I'll see you in QUESTING MAYHEM PART TWO!
Botania is a magic mod that focuses on magical flowers and nature.

Thaumcraft is a magic mod all about collecting magical vis and researching powerful spells and tools. There is more to the mod than just what is shown in this questline, so feel free to play around with the mod and the thaumonomicon after completing this questline.
Evilcraft adds several quality of life utility items. The items are obtained from rituals and sacrifices, though.
Magical Crops allows you to obtain almost every material in the modpack by growing it out of the ground with seeds.

betterquesting:10.name:8: The Mod to End All Mods
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Avaritia is one of the most challenging and resource-intensive mods to ever exist. It features a 9x9 crafting table which will be used extensively. In addition, there are items you must collect which requires thousands of resources. This is where you will use every single part of your acquired resources you've been gathering since you started Questing Mayhem.

Don't worry, though. No matter how bad you think it is, remember these two things. This questline, questbook, and modpack are designed to be completed. It is possible to do this. Second, there's more beyond this questline. This is not the end.

ProjectE adds ways to transfer items into other items using a currency of EMC. Almost every item and block in the game has an EMC value which you can see in the tooltip. Take full use of that value with ProjectE.
It's not over yet...
